page.title: 16MIXED FARMING
page.content: MIXED FARMING Mixed farming includes arable,sheep, beef and forestry.Arable is financially the most important with the main crops being wheat and barley grown in rotation with grass and swedes as break crops.These are being superceded by oilseed rape and vegetables.Barley is for animal feed, malting or export.Wheat is for bread, biscuit and poultry feed mills.Oilseed rape is for cooking oil,peas for animal feed and vegetables for a freezing plant.Beef calves are bred from suckler cows on poorer land and then fattened on better grass.Hill sheep are kept on poorer land to breed prolific hybrid sheep for richer pastures.The most marginal land is used for forestry, producing fencing materials and industrial timber.
